author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
National Conference (NC) president Farooq Abdullah on Friday said the Peoples Democratic Party-BJP alliance “cannot provide a sustainable government” in the State.

“The 2014 verdict and the obtaining political stalemate in the State has proven beyond doubt that reactionary and divisive parties may manage temporary electoral gains by whipping up passions and polarising the situation but ultimately they cannot sustain the mandate,” said Dr. Abdullah, while referring to the PDP-BJP alliance.

Pointing to the PDP-BJP logjam over government formation following Chief Minister Mufti Muhammad Sayeed’s demise on January 7, Dr. Abdullah said, “His party alone can give a stable and people-friendly government.”

Terming the coalition culture “against the interests of the State,” the NC leader said, “A strong, secular, forward-looking and a vibrant party like the NC can steer the State out of the mess created by divisive and opportunistic political entities.”

Attacks Kanhaiya

Dr. Abdullah, while defending the Army on the accusation of alleged rapes in J&K, said: “Go and ask him [Kanhaiya Kumar] why he is spitting venom against the Army. One who speaks against the Army is not the right man.”

He praised beleaguered businessman Vijay Mallya and said he was “a gentleman, not a crook.”

Praises Mallya

“He started a very good airline... unfortunately that airline was his greatest failure. Whatever trouble he has today is because of Kingfisher...I’d call him a gentleman , he’s a human being, he’s led a huge company, he went bad like so many people go , but you don’t call them crooks,” he said.
title: ‘PDP-BJP alliance cannot provide stable govt.’
